documents.document: @Wildantlers I'd be happy to block you again if you're just going to be a dick.
Very nice evening in Hastings with these great @NZGreens candidates and some of our supporters. https://t.co/IE4Zu2Xzna
Heading North from Wairarapa. Everything was pretty green until Norsewood, then bam, dry as in HB.
Great to see @NZGreens te reo policy prompt debate. Next week's letters to the Ed should be fun ;-) #stirrers https://t.co/LcxiIU2NeP
@andrew_hoggard Good read - thanks. "to date" needs a start point to be more informative though. @Lewisridge_Farm @dairymanNZ @m_herbert
@krislane Just showed up this morning I think.
@RFStew Damn, planned to listen, but events conspired against me.
@Sam_Sheppo @m_herbert @tutukaus @dairymanNZ Some conversations would be easier over a beer (or six).
@Lewisridge_Farm I've been asking for the numbers behind the survey for quite a while. Feel free to illuminate me. @dairymanNZ @m_herbert
@Sam_Sheppo Not sure what you're asking Sam. @m_herbert @tutukaus @dairymanNZ
@m_herbert The issue is the scale and growth of the industry and its impacts. It's bigger than individual farmers. @tutukaus @dairymanNZ 2/2
@m_herbert I don't doubt that. I don't know how else to convey that you, and farmers like you are not the problem @tutukaus @dairymanNZ 1/2
@RodMullin Parliamentary Commissioner for the Environment did a study a few years back. @m_herbert @dairymanNZ
@tutukaus How would a campaign against palm oil help with NZ's water quality? @m_herbert @dairymanNZ
@dairymanNZ You don't think the magical $1B has been used as propaganda even in the slightest? @m_herbert
@dairymanNZ So using $1B figure is just a neutral fact, but questioning it is "cheap sarcastic political point scoring"? OK then. @m_herbert
@tutukaus You've seen Greenpeace campaigning against palm oil too, right? @m_herbert @dairymanNZ
@tutukaus I thought we were talking water quality? @m_herbert @dairymanNZ
@m_herbert @dairymanNZ But I do agree: water quality bottom lines should apply to all water, urban and rural. That's Greens policy BTW.
@m_herbert @dairymanNZ I imagine it's pretty simple: urban point sources account for ~5% of NZ water pollution. Go for big wins first?
@dairymanNZ @m_herbert Asking for the numbers from a small, self-reported self-selected survey that was extrapolated to $1B is unreasonable?
@dairymanNZ You're putting words in my mouth. @m_herbert
@dairymanNZ Not going to pretend that. But think about industry response to criticism. @m_herbert
@m_herbert Maybe that's the only thing they have left when industry response is "Shut up / It's fine / Why do you hate farmers?" every time.
@m_herbert Part of the problem Matthew IMO, any critique of the *industry impacts* (not farmers personally) is met with hyperbole like that.
@Wildantlers That joke's already been made ;-)
@dairymanNZ @Kris_Bartley Speed of action and agreement on scale of the problem are the major issues IMO. The rest is noise.
@m_herbert Just pointing out the incongruity between the title of the PR and the content.
One might get the impression @DairyNZ are not entirely serious about working with @GreenpeaceNZ
So PR from @DairyNZ titled "Quit the attacks and let's work together" attacks @GreenpeaceNZ in 11 of 22 paragraphs. https://t.co/7QBpo6Wz6c
@LewSOS incredible.
@GlenHerud Sounds great. We've been doing the self-re-seeding for 8 years. Amazing to see how much white and red clover here now :-)
@StuFlemingNZ As you'd expect from a staffer tasked with the job, surely?
National: Tough on crime but seemingly ignorant of the causes. What could that $500m achieve as an investment in our kids' futures?
@robellcampbin RNZ have it
@grumpybirb I think @Rdiva has some recipes for amazing date-based slices and cakes
I think it's a fair point: exceptional circumstances should require demonstration of exceptional (and quantifiable)â€¦ https://t.co/aLJd1KtI1L
@OliverHMSmith Yes, cos my tweet was clearly a well-researched and completely serious proposal to reform both immigration and tax law :-p
@OliverHMSmith Yeah, that's what I was modelling my idea on.
@lancewiggs I don't suspect anything malevolent: it's just the idea of special treatment that doesn't sit well with most kiwis
@lancewiggs I'll leave it to you to tell Peter we've changed the terms of his arrangement ;-)
I find "we should be proud the ultra-rich want citizenship" as odious as "but they'll leave if we make them pay tax". Social contract much?
Modest proposal: Non-residents can buy citizenship but all their income is subject to NZ tax. Think of it as lay-by for when they move here.
@MxDEJ Yeah, I'm looking forward to people smarter than us (well, me at least) figuring it out :-)
@MxDEJ Just trying to imagine the benefits that citizenship might confer, that being a non-resident resident might not...
@bootstheory Sure, but wouldn't residency give the same benefit?
So have we gotten to the bottom of *why* Thiel particularly wanted citizenship, not just (unused) residency? Buy land? Party donations?
@dairymanNZ @GeraldPiddock It popped up in my "in case you missed it" so it was useful, for once :-)
The last thing I read telling them as much was @dairymanNZ so I'll say well done for making them see sense. https://t.co/zhD4kWKBVM
@BR3NDA And as for the concept that learning a language might aid in the learning of other subjects...
@dairymanNZ @TrumpDraws Correct procedure :-)
Yep, this :-) https://t.co/5IDswI170P
@adzebill Good to know, but how might a punter know the difference?
@adzebill Related: is it possible to have moa bones in private ownership in a non-dodgy way?
@adzebill I would love to have something like that at home, but not a stolen taonga.

@PolarBearFarm "You notice he doesn't talk about jobs..."
No, because you literally used up the universe's allocation of the word "jobs"
@PolarBearFarm Wait, jobs and what? I didn't quite catch it ;-)
Those would be a fine start... https://t.co/wWKSlTMGZW
Boy, for what should be a campaign event selling his vision for NZ, @pmbillenglish sure has spent a lot of time bagging @NZGreens.
@sunilwilliams Ecological wisdom: infinite growth impossible on a finite planet https://t.co/jlTDQQ2Qpa @NZGreens
On a finite planet, with climate change bearing down, and half the Western world in political meltdown. Growth. https://t.co/DOR15INigX
@jgmccl Our almost 5 y/o has been learning via pre-school. She loves it and it's been effortless for her at that age. Such a gift for life.
@southernlimitnz Good question. I can't speak for party or members until they decide, but fair to say the tech is moving faster than we are
@southernlimitnz Stance is based on the Royal Commission findings. Is any other party suggesting NZ does otherwise? I'm happy to revisit tho

Yep, we're* fine, so screw those other people.
*some of us are https://t.co/c3aEiu2oay
@richardhills777 His 2pm presser tomorrow? Seems likely to be the big announcement we're all waiting for.
@richardhills777 Is that on Twitter or Facebook?
@jgmccl War, or longer term, climate change: he may doom us either way.
@KoanuiFarming @BradMarkham81 I'm not sure how you turn that around, but getting kids who *want* to be in the industry must help eventually?
@KoanuiFarming @BradMarkham81 Is there some chicken and egg too? Better staff require better pay, but that requires better staff etc...

@phyllisofickle That is pretty much the perfect description. I hope it catches on*
*I'd like to steal it
Sailing past dictatorship, right into banana republic. https://t.co/CQBuchGpE5
@BradMarkham81 It's a concern. Don't think it's very different here in Wairarapa TBH. It needs to change though if ag is to keep progressing
@GuyonEspiner did a good job giving @pmbillenglish every opportunity to show leadership this morning. Sadly, we saw none.
@emmawehipeihana Oh yes, I know that one :-)
@emmawehipeihana G has the patience of a saint some days.
"It's not racist but..." https://t.co/5tOZhBXRxf
@RobJStewartNZ Sorry to hear, but so many other ways you can contribute to the mahi ahead ðŸ’š
@RFStew Found it. Yeah...see what you mean.
@RFStew Oh, haven't seen that one...
@RFStew Ruh-roh... I could grow out the hair for more of a Trudeau, but I couldn't be arsed with the upkeep ;-)
@Te_Taipo I love how is back catalogue of tweets is as voluminous as the bible: you can find a tweet for any occasion.
Or you could look at the effect of the policy on actual humans... https://t.co/UNTayTSZqN
Anyway, thank you @pmbillenglish for responding. Now let's #DoubleTheQuota please?
Not meek. Just the mildest, least-likely-to-cause-offence words you could imagine. But definitely not meek. https://t.co/v14q4tumjJ
@damienmgrant @paulbrislen Surely the point of learning from history is that we shouldn't wait until it gets that bad before acting?
@AndreAlessi @Dovil @_hi_tide I understand, and appreciate the insight.
@AndreAlessi @_hi_tide I can't disagree with your reasons, but I'd argue a no-vote is still a vote if it allows another National term.
@m_herbert Agree, but hard when issue is whole industry impact @Sam_Sheppo @GrantSc24289660 @PaulBMcGill @Lewisridge_Farm @MorrisonFarming
@GrantSc24289660 What happens to our brand at that point? @Sam_Sheppo @PaulBMcGill @Lewisridge_Farm @MorrisonFarming @m_herbert
From that last clip: a tally of how many Americans have died in terrorist attacks, by nationals of the "banned" couâ€¦ https://t.co/E7C4WTUM2r
@philquin This one suits my current anger level. Your mileage may vary. https://t.co/yqKE94QSCB
*Some* world leaders. Not ours (yet?) come on @pmbillenglish https://t.co/rAy5unG2Ru
@emmawehipeihana Ha! Don't know about that - more laughing to avoid crying.
@emmawehipeihana "The first rule of dystopian book club is read fast: you're starting a few chapters behind the bad guys"
Nice to be back, but man Wellington, you need to have a chat to Auckland about how Summer works ;-)
@emmawehipeihana Everyone trying to get ahead of the playbook?
@TinaMakereti It's a cracker, isn't it?
@Absurdum14 Sure, but let's see what he says first.
I'd hope NZ response to President Trump's Muslim ban would be something like this...but will our PM even comment? https://t.co/vbmtHY7kOY
